Description: Weather station ID
Flight date (yyyymmdd)
Quarter (1-4)
Day of month
Day of week
Unique Carrier Code
An identification number assigned by US DOT to identify a unique airline (carrier)
Code assigned by IATA and commonly used to identify a carrier
Flight tail number
Flight number assigned by the operating carrier
An identification number assigned by US DOT to identify a unique airport
Origin airport
Origin airport, city name
Origin airport, state code
Origin airport, state name
An identification number assigned by US DOT to identify a unique airport.
Destination airport
Destination airport, city name
Destination airport, state code
Destination airport, state name
CRS departure rime (local time: hhmm)
Actual departure time (local time: hhmm)
Difference in minutes between scheduled and actual departure time
Departure delay Indicator, 15 Minutes or More (1=Yes)
Departure delay intervals, every (15 minutes from <-15 to >180)
CRS departure time block, hourly Intervals
The time from departure gate leave to takeoff in minutes
The time from landing to arrival at the gate in minutes
CRS arrival Time (local time: hhmm)
Actual arrival Time (local time: hhmm)
Difference in minutes between scheduled and actual arrival time
Arrival delay indicator, 15 minutes or more (1=Yes)
Arrival delay intervals, every (15-minutes from <-15 to >180)
CRS arrival time block, hourly intervals
Cancelled flight indicator (1=Yes)
Specifies the reason for cancellation
Diverted flight indicator (1=Yes)
CRS elapsed time of flight in minutes
Elapsed time of flight in minutes
Flight time in minutes
Distance between airports in miles
Distance intervals, every 250 miles, for flight segment
Carrier delay in minutes
Weather delay in minutes
Nation air system delay in munites
Security delay in munites
Late aircraft delay in minutes
Scheduled flight departure in date time format
Scheduled flight departure in UTC date time format
4 hours before scheduled flight departure in UTC date time format
2 hours before scheduled flight departure in UTC date time format
Atmospheric pressure reduced to sea level using temperature profile of the standard atmosphere. Given in inches of Mercury (in Hg)
Dew point temperature. It is given here in whole degrees Fahrenheit
Dry-bulb temperature and is commonly used as the standard air temperature reported. It is given here in whole degrees Fahrenheit
Total Liquid Content (TLC) which is the water equivalent amount of precipitation for the day (in inches to hundredths). This is all types of precipitation (melted and frozen)
Weather types describe precipitation or obstructions to vision occurring at the time of observation
Change in atmospheric pressure

Pressure tendency (In general a 0 through 3 here indicates an increase in pressure over previous 3 hours and a 5 through 8 indicates a decrease over the previous 3 hours and 4 indicates no change during the previous 3 hours
The relative humidity given to the nearest whole percentage
Cloud layer and coverage condition ranked from 0 (clear sky) to 10 (overcast)
Sea level pressure given in inches of mercury (in Hg)
Atmospheric pressure observed at the station during the time of observation. Given in inches of mercury (in Hg)
Wet-bulb temperature given in whole degrees Fahrenheit
Wind direction from true north using compass directions (e.g. 360 = true north, 180 = south, 270 = west, etc.)
Wind gusts occurring during time of observation. Given in miles per hour (mph)
Speed of the wind at the time of observation given in miles per hour (mph)
The horizontal distance an object can be seen and identified given in whole miles
